meanings.definition: A direct confrontation or competition between two individuals or groups.
meanings.sent1: The faceoffs between the two teams were intense and competitive.
meanings.sent2: In a faceoff, each side tries to outdo the other in a direct competition.
meanings.sent3: During the faceoffs, the tension in the room was palpable.
meanings.sent4: The faceoffs in the debate club were like battles of wits.
meanings.sent5: The faceoffs in the courtroom were like verbal jousts.

meanings.definition: The act of facing an opponent in a sports game, typically in hockey or lacrosse.
meanings.sent1: The faceoffs in the hockey game were crucial for determining possession.
meanings.sent2: Players practice their technique for faceoffs to gain an advantage in the game.
meanings.sent3: The faceoffs in the championship match were nail-biting moments.
meanings.sent4: Winning the faceoffs consistently can lead to victory in the game.
meanings.sent5: The faceoffs in the final minutes of the match were thrilling to watch.

meanings.definition: The moment when players in a game line up opposite each other to begin play.
meanings.sent1: The faceoffs at the start of each period set the tone for the game.
meanings.sent2: During the faceoffs, players focus on their strategy and readiness.
meanings.sent3: The faceoffs at the beginning of the game were like a ritual.
meanings.sent4: The faceoffs mark the official start of the match.
meanings.sent5: The faceoffs create a sense of anticipation among the players.
